citation.article-title: Anaeroglobus geminatus gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the family Veillonellaceae.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Anaeroglobus geminatus sp. nov.
Anaeroglobus geminatus (ge.mi.na'tus. L. masc. adj. geminatus paired, double, referring to the twin cells of this organism)
Cells are Gram-negative after coloration, non-sporeforming cocci that occur in pairs or short chains.
The cells are coccoid to ellipsoidal.
Individual cells are about 0.5-1.1 μm in diameter.
Colonies on blood agar after 2 days incubation are small, circular, convex, translucent with a smooth surface.
Catalase, gelatinase, indole and nitrate-reduction tests are negative.
With the exception of galactose and mannose, most of the usual carbohydrates are not fermented.
The metabolic end products are acetic acid, propionic acid, isobutyric acid, butyric acid and isovaleric acid.
The type strain is strain AIP 313.00T (=CIP 106856T=CCUG 44773T).
